sub_title: Urban Scientist | PhD Candidate in Urban Simulation of Public Health Interventions for EXPANSE
summary:
I am deeply fascinated by cities, their complexity and the diversity of their components, but also their potential in addressing the most pressing social, ecological and economic challenges of our time. Passionate for sustainable transitions, I took it upon me to understand as good as possible the interactions between the built and physical environment, sociotechnical systems and the behavior of people and resources, which as a whole cause the emergence of more or less desirable outcomes. I believe that urban and regional sciences and development is an exciting field to work in, considering all the new technological possibilities and the creativity that can be used to find solutions to highly salient problems.

I am currently doing my PhD in Agent-based Modeling of Urban Health Interventions to prevent cardio-metabolic pulmonary diseases at the Institute for Risk Assessment Sciences and the Department of Geosciences at Utrecht University as well as UMC Utrecht. For that, I am integrating GIS and ABM simulation modeling to understand exposure dynamics in cities (air pollution, noise, physical exercise, active transport) and how urban interventions can help addressing them. Moreover, I am attempting to quantify all social costs and benefits of the analysed intervention scenarios.

For the long run, I decided for myself that I want to work in two fields simultaneously: Research and Development. Interfering in such a complex system as a city, I think one cannot go without the other. 

 I have gathered substantial experience and skills to conduct robust science
- I completing my Research Master of Science in Urban and Economic Geography with summa cum laude (GPA 8.75) at Utrecht University
- I was a research assistant at the Center for Science and Technology Studies in Leiden
- I was a visiting student and research Assistant at the MIT Sustainable Urbanization Lab, Cambridge, USA
- I am capable of doing: Regression modelling, Agent-based Modeling, Network Science, advanced GIS, Cluster Analysis, simple Neural Nets and more
- Experience organizing physical and online conferences and events

Next I also collected experience in urban development
- internship within a city development department in Mönchengladbach, Germany
- intership in a regional development NGO in Batticaloa, Sri Lanka
- started a software development project for urban resource and favor matching to help communities deal with the new challenges of Covid-19 (we participated in the Covid19 Global Hack and EUvsVirus Hackathon)

projects.title: Provision - A Ressource Matching Platform to help with Covid19 challenges
projects.description:
I was team lead for our participation in the Covid19 Global Hackathon, in which we managed to develop a working demo in 2.5 days for the following App, which we are currently continuing to implement.

Provision is at once a WebApp, social institution and distribution infrastructure, which facilitates an exchange of resources, skills and ideas in order to enhance our adaptability to collectively satisfy our needs.

The COVID-19 crisis and its unexpected challenges cause many already established systems or institutions to struggle with delivering their services and adpating to the various new needs that emerge in face of the rapid, radical changes. While this problem is decentralized, communication barriers and the competitiveness of marketplaces hinder the ability of local groups and individuals to generate context-specific solutions from the bottom up and find the adequat human and physical resources to implement them. We need a plattform on which needs can be expressed, project ideas discussed and solutions matched to enabling resources people or organizations can be offer.

To fill that gap, Provision aims to improve the use of existing value: To help realizing ideas and foster collaboration, users can offer resources and skills, which are then matched to local project proposals or favor requests. 

In conclusion, Provision is empowering solidarity with regenerative collaboration within local and global communities. We intent to engage members in a sandbox-mode where we can not just provide resources, skills and implement ideas, but also test laws, norms, transform markets into Commons. We make a stand together against the threat that is COVID-19 and go beyond.

profile_positions.description:
Currently, I am a PhD Candidate for:
EXPANSE – Exposome Powered tools for a healthy urban living
& EXPOSOME-NL

In that context, I am developing spatial agent-based modeling simulations of urban interventions to prevent cardio-metabolic pulmonary diseases. The latter are caused by urban environmental exposures such as Air Pollution and Noise but also behavioral exposures such as physical activity, diet or smoking behavior. With a wide spectrum of intervention possibilities in the transport system, land use, architecture, commercial and housing market regulation, cities have many ways to influence these environmental and behavioral factors. My goal is to find a way to build robust simulation models to reliably estimate the impact of interventions on health and social outcomes before implementation.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate in ABM Simulation of Urban Health Interventions
Expert | Community Member of Think Tank

profile_positions.description: Urban AI is a think tank that engages a global community of pioneers in a critical debate on topics around Urban Artifical Intelligence and proposes ethical modes of governance and sustainable uses of such technologies.
profile_positions.title: Emerging Leader in Urban Artificial Intelligence
Project Organizer of the online Conference on the Geography of Innovation and Complexity 2020

profile_positions.description: I have written my Master thesis under supervision of Prof. Siqi Zheng at MIT and Prof. Simon Scheider at UU, analysing the spatiotemporal impact of public transport expansion on amenity compositions, behavioural patterns and land use in various European cities. Hereby I developed a new indicator for Multifunctional amenity mixes and explore heterogeneity between amenity types based on fine-grained Big data of one of the major place-based social media, Foursquare. I received a 9 (distinction) for my Master Thesis.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Student

profile_positions.description: I was part of a research group of Prof. Siqi Zheng's Sustainable Urbanization Lab that investigates the impact of accessibility changes through subway expansion on different aspects of urban vibrancy in a cross-comparative study.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: My role was to be "Single Point of Contact" for the listing, distribution and updating of the tasks that had to be organized in the weeks before and during the conference, in other words the management of  logistics. Therefore, I was communicating with the other coordinators, the staff team, the conference sponsors and the facilities' officials and attended various coordination meetings. Apart from that, I wrote two articles, one for the introduction of speakers and one summarizing the key takeaways from the conference. I also chaired a session on the third day, in which 6 young scholars presented their research findings.
profile_positions.title: Coordination Support for the Second Annual Conference on the Geography of Innovation and Complexity

profile_positions.description: My job at the Center for Science, Technology and Innovation Studies of the Leiden University encompassed tasks ranging from the data preparation and analysis of large relational datasets on corporate research networks to preparing and processing spatial data as well as Natural Language using SQL, R and QGIS.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: In this internship, I participated in the organization of two events for the participation of citizens and stakeholders in the renewal of Mönchengladbach's Theater Park. Moreover, I researched and conducted interviews with residents in public spaces and libraries about their attitude towards the concept and implications of Smart City initiatives. Finally, I was involved in the compilation and completion of a register of spaces for redevelopment with MapInfo. Throughout the internship I could accompany the head of the urban development department and employees in meetings with other municipal departments and external actors.
profile_positions.title: Intern in the Department of City Development Mönchengladbach

profile_positions.description: The volunteer project included daily classes introducing basic Permaculture principles, strategies and designs. Moreover, each day we participated in the agricultural and bio-construction tasks that had to be performed. We installed a water drainage system adequate for the particular location and weather condition at the edge of a Colombian jungle, constructed a dorm house out of local materials and planted, nurtured and harvested plants in the experimental permaculture garden.
profile_positions.title: Participation in a permaculture and bio-construction project

profile_positions.description: In this internship I was involved in tasks ranging from the data cleaning, processing and analysis with SPSS, writing of an scientific article about multidimensional poverty and disability in Germany, filing of tenders for research jobs and background investigation for the development of an urban integration concept.
profile_positions.title: Internship at the Social Science Research Institute ISG

volunteer_experiences.role: Social Worker for the reception and care of refugees on Lesbos, Greece
volunteer_experiences.description: Our camp organized night shifts to identify refugee boats that arrive from Turkey and guide them with lights away from the lighthouse, which was the most dangerous spot to land. I was there when the coup in Turkey happened, which led to an increase in boats arriving. We had a procedure to offer cloths, food, hot beverage and information to the people that arrived and coordinated with the local municipality to transfer them to the refugee camps. During the day, we volunteered in a male youth refugee camp that was situated in a deserted area of the island.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer for a local NGO for village empowerment and sustainability

company.name: Village Empowerment Academy in Batticaloa, Sri Lanka

volunteer_experiences.description: I organized and taught English classes for children aged 6 to 18, helped preparing the inaugoration ceremony of the local library, participated in the renovation of a school and co-organised a beach cleaning day for local residents.
